result.execSummary:
The defendant Marternez Markeith Moore was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Child Abuse-Recklessly Cause Harm [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.03(3)(b).
  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence.

Pay supervision fees.
AODA assessment. Comply with any treatment.  Maintain absolute sobriety.  Random urine screens.

supervisions.notes: Defendant advised he is a convicted felon and may not possess any firearms.
Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Original SENTENCING Transcript (19 pages) commencing 09-17-2015 received and filed.  CH

Defendant Marternez Markeith Moore in court with attorney J. Dennis Thornton.  Molly M Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
cab
Victim statement received and filed.
As to count 2:
  The Court ordered the Defendant to serve 6 months in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence with credit for 126 days time served.  

As to count 1:
  The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of  3 YEARS, CONSECUTIVE with any other sentence, with credit for -0-  DAYS time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is  1 1/2 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 1 1/2 YEARS.  The defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and the Wisconsin Substance Abuse

The Court imposed the following conditions of extended supervision:  
- Complete batterer's intervention program.
-  Attend parenting classes.
- AODA assessment; comply with any treatment.
- Maintain absolute sobriety; random urine screens.
- Attend treatment and/or counseling as determined.
- Pursuant to the request of the victim, court modified the no contact order to a no violent contact order.
- No contact with firearms.
- Pay DV surcharge  and DNA surcharge plus all other costs and surcharges during the sentence; civil judgment if not paid.
- Pay supervision fees.

Received and filed:
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgment;
Pretrial Incarceration Credit.

Defendant Marternez Markeith Moore in court with attorney J. Dennis Thornton.  Defendant Marternez Markeith Moore in custody.  Molly M Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
cab
Amended information filed.
 Defense counsel waived reading of the Complaint and entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of defendant.
Defendant wants to change his plea.
As to counts 1 and 2 (as amended):
		  Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant is advised he/she is a convicted felon and may not possess any firearms. 
As to count 3:
On motion of the state and pursuant to negotiations, court ordered count 3 dismissed and read-in for sentencing.
Case adjourned for sentencing in branch 36.
Jury trial date of 08/31/15 vacated.
  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 17, 2015 at 08:30 am.

for joinder of cases received and filed.
cab

Defendant Marternez Markeith Moore in court with attorney J. Dennis Thornton.  Defendant Marternez Markeith Moore in custody.  Molly M Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case Recalled. Defendant now present in court.  Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court.  Defendant enters a SPEEDY TRIAL DEMAND.  Parties are notified that effective August 1, 2015 this case will be reassigned per rotation to Judge Jeffrey Kremers, Branch 36 in Courthouse room 502. Case set for Final Pretrial & Jury Trial in branch 36.

Attorney J. Dennis Thornton in court, defendant Marternez Markeith Moore not in court, in custody.  Molly M Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 1st call, defense counsel requests to pass case to allow defendant to be produced. Case passed.  Final pre-trial scheduled for August 18, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for August 31, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Marternez Markeith Moore in court with attorney J. Dennis Thornton.  Defendant Marternez Markeith Moore in custody.  Molly M Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state: Milwaukee Police Officer Karlee Kennon.  Exhibit #1 received. Exhibit #1 withdrawn. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 23.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 4, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Electronic Monitoring and Supervision.  DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Kaila C or KMC dob 2/8/14

Defendant Martinez Markeith Moore in court with attorney Jeff Allen Schwarz.  Defendant Martinez Markeith Moore in custody.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grady, Branch 23. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL. 
  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he/she may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he/she meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).

  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 26, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
